alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 8:17PM CDT until March 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Choctaw and Clarke. In southeast Mississippi, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesboro, Silas, Gilbertown, Toxey, Emory, Isney, Gretna, Evansboro, Contwell, Water Valley, Aquilla, Paragon, Souwilpa, Bolinger, Old Samuel, Boice, Hiwannee, Barrytown, Woodwards and West King.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
